page.title: 05Village Church
page.content: The church of St.James the Less in Sulgrave was built in the reign of Edward lll (1327-77) but its stones were brought from an earlier church built near the disused windmill. Today the church offers one service each Sunday morning and an evensong once a month.It shares its incumbent with Thorpe Mandeville and Culworth.He conducts services of marriage,baptism and burial of the dead.The Mothers' Union meet once a month. At Harvest Festival the church is decorated with vegetables,flowers and fruit and the service attended by a large proportion of the community.At Christmas and Easter special services are held and the children from the village school take part with songs, prayers,poems, paintings and hand-bell ringing.
